question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/chunk_executor/mod.rs] [Function: ChunkExecutorInner::new()] [Pre-committed ledger reading] At line 238, ChunkCommitQueue::new_from_db reads pre-committed ledger - can corrupted DB state cause initialization to read invalid versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/chunk_executor/mod.rs] [Function: state_view()] [State clone overhead] At line 258, state.clone() creates a copy - for large states, can this cause performance issues or memory exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/chunk_executor/mod.rs] [Function: update_ledger()] [Persisted state summary] At line 350, ProvableStateSummary::new_persisted reads from DB - can stale reads cause state checkpointing against wrong base state? (High)

(High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/chunk_executor/mod.rs] [Function: enqueue_chunk()] [First version validation] At lines 304-310, first version matching is checked - can manipulation of parent_state.next_version() allow chunks to be inserted at wrong positions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/chunk_executor/mod.rs] [Function: enqueue_chunks()] [Version range calculation] At lines 459-460, expecting_version() provides chunk_begin - can race conditions cause multiple chunks to start at same version? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/chunk_executor/mod.rs] [Function: remove_and_apply()] [First version field] At line 695, first_version: begin_version is set - is this always consistent with the chunk's actual position in the ledger? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/chunk_executor/mod.rs] [Function: enqueue_for_ledger_update()] [State update race] At line 80 in chunk_commit_queue.rs, latest_state is updated before pushing to queue - can concurrent updates cause state to skip versions? (High)
